title: Britain’s Got Talent winner Colin Thackery, interview: ‘I’ll die happy after singing for the Queen’
text:
Chelsea Pensioner and Britain’s Got Talent winner Colin Thackery tells James Hall about becoming a pop star at the age of 89

‘Oh God, I knew that would come up!” Colin Thackery winces and recoils into the bench. I’ve just reminded him of the night in June when he was pictured clutching a bottle of vodka in Tramp, the swish London nightclub. Surrounded by a bevy of female admirers (and Bobby Davro), he was dubbed a “secret party animal” by the tabloids.

Thackery is 89 and a Chelsea Pensioner.

“I was a bit naive,” he explains. It was a charity event, and a fellow Pensioner had invited him to sing. “Some chap said, ‘Can I have your photograph, sir?’ I didn’t know he was a pap.” Thackery didn’t...
description: Chelsea Pensioner and Britain’s Got Talent winner Colin Thackery tells James Hall about becoming a pop star at the age of 89
